title: How to Copy & Paste on a Chromebook

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to copy and paste.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to copy and paste. First, IT pro Mitch Harris says to use a mouse, touchpad, or touchscreen to highlight the text or content you want to copy. [1] X Expert Source Mitch Harris Consumer Technology Expert Expert Interview. 31 August 31 2021. With a mouse or touchpad, place your cursor at the start of the text, then click and drag it along the text until you’ve highlighted your entire selection. Or, highlight the entire text by clicking the text, then pressing ctrl + A.

steps.title: Press Control + C to copy.
steps.content: Press Control + C to copy. Harris explains that this copies the content into the Chromebook's clipboard, where it’s ready to pasted elsewhere. [2] X Expert Source Mitch Harris Consumer Technology Expert Expert Interview. 31 August 31 2021.

steps.title: Click on the place where you want to insert the content.
steps.content: Click on the place where you want to insert the content. Position the cursor where you want your content pasted, then click as though you were to start typing.

steps.title: Press Control + V to paste.
steps.content: Press Control + V to paste. Harris says that doing so inserts your content into the selected location.. [3] X Expert Source Mitch Harris Consumer Technology Expert Expert Interview. 31 August 31 2021. Or, paste without formatting (italics, bold, etc.) by pressing ctrl + shift + v.

steps.title: Use your cursor to highlight the content you want to copy and paste.
steps.content: Use your cursor to highlight the content you want to copy and paste. Click on the beginning of the content you want to copy, then left-click and drag the cursor to the other end to highlight the text you want to copy.

steps.title: Right-click on the highlighted text.
steps.content: Right-click on the highlighted text. This launches the context menu, which appears next to your cursor. To right-click on the touchpad, either hold the “Alt” button and then click on the touchpad (Alt + click) or tap the touchpad with two fingers at the same time.

steps.title: Click the Copy button.
steps.content: Click the Copy button. You’ll see this button near the top of the context menu. Click it with your cursor to store the copied text in your Chromebook’s clipboard, where it’s ready to be pasted.

steps.title: Right-click on the place where you want to paste your content.
steps.content: Right-click on the place where you want to paste your content. Navigate to the place or document where you want to insert the content. Right-click there to open another context menu. Or, left-click the place where you want to paste the text to drop your cursor there and make sure it’s where you want it to be, then right-click to open the context menu, for more accuracy. To right-click on the touchpad, either hold the Alt button and then click on the touchpad (Alt + click) or tap the touchpad with two fingers at the same time.

steps.title: Click on Paste.
steps.content: Click on Paste . It's a selection near the top of the context menu. Doing so inserts the copied content into your selected location. You can also select “Paste without formatting” to only paste the raw text, without any formatting (bold, italics, etc) from its original location.

steps.title: Double tap the text to select it.
steps.content: Double tap the text to select it. On a touchscreen, select the content you want to copy by double-tapping it, then drag the highlighted handles to include the desired text.

steps.title: Tap on copy on the context menu.
steps.content: Tap on copy on the context menu. Once you highlight your text, a context menu will automatically appear next to it. Tap “Copy,” near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap and hold on the place where you want to paste the content.
steps.content: Tap and hold on the place where you want to paste the content. Navigate to the document or text box where you’d like to paste. Then, tap and hold there to make a context menu appear.

steps.title: Tap the Paste button.
steps.content: Tap the Paste button. You’ll see this button near the top of the context menu. Tap on it to paste your previously copied content into its new location. You can also select “Paste without formatting” to only paste the raw text, without any formatting (bold, italics, etc) from its original location.

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to copy and paste using your cursor.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to copy and paste using your cursor. Use the touchpad or a mouse to highlight the text or content you want to copy. To do this, click and drag your mouse across the text.

steps.title: Click on the ⋮ button.
steps.content: Click on the ⋮ button. Find this icon in the top-right corner of the window. It looks like 3 vertical dots stacked on top of each other.

steps.title: Click on Find and edit.
steps.content: Click on Find and edit . This appears as one of the options in the Chrome menu.

steps.title: Click on Copy.
steps.content: Click on Copy . This option is often near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Left-click on the place where you want to insert the content.
steps.content: Left-click on the place where you want to insert the content. Navigate to the document or text box where you’ll paste the content, and position the cursor in the location where you want your content pasted, then left-click

steps.title: Click on the ⋮ button.
steps.content: Click on the ⋮ button. Find this in the top-right corner of the window. As before, it appears as 3 consecutive dots. This button opens a menu.

steps.title: Click on Find and edit.
steps.content: Click on Find and edit . This appears as one of the options in the Chrome menu.

steps.title: Click on Paste.
steps.content: Click on Paste . Find it near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Press Alt while clicking on the image.
steps.content: Press Alt while clicking on the image. This launches a menu with several options. Or, use two fingers while clicking with your trackpad, or hit ctrl + C. If you have a mouse connected to your Chromebook, right-click the image instead.

steps.title: Click Copy Image.
steps.content: Click Copy Image . Find this option near the center of the menu.

steps.title: Press Alt and click on the place where you want to insert the image.
steps.content: Press Alt and click on the place where you want to insert the image. Navigate to the place where you want to paste the image. Position the cursor in the location where you want your content pasted. Hold “Alt” while clicking on the place, or use two fingers to click with your trackpad. If you’re using a mouse, simply right-click instead. Or, hit ctrl + v on your keyboard.

steps.title: Click on Paste.
steps.content: Click on Paste . Find this option near the top of the menu that appeared when you clicked.

steps.title: Press Alt while clicking on the video.
steps.content: Press Alt while clicking on the video. This launches a menu with several options. Or, use two fingers while clicking with your trackpad. If you have a mouse connected to your Chromebook, right-click the image instead.

steps.title: Click either Copy video URL or Copy embed code.
steps.content: Click either Copy video URL or Copy embed code . Selecting “Copy video URL” will copy the video’s web address to your clipboard. Selecting “Copy embed code” will copy a string of code that may be used to embed the video in other code, like on a custom webpage. Note that it’s not possible to “copy” the content of the video itself—only the video address. Or, play the video and navigate to the part you want to copy, then 2-finger click the video and select “copy video URL at current time.”

steps.title: Press Alt and click on the place where you want to insert the video.
steps.content: Press Alt and click on the place where you want to insert the video. Navigate to the place where you want to paste the video’s URL or embed code. Position the cursor in the location where you want your content pasted. Hold “Alt” while clicking on the place, or use two fingers to click with your trackpad. If you’re using a mouse, simply right-click instead. Or, hit ctrl + v on your keyboard.

steps.title: Click on Paste.
steps.content: Click on Paste . Find this option near the top of the menu that appeared when you clicked.
